sourcing.instructions: B: Obtain from a chemical supplier or online marketplace. Nd: Purchase from a rare earth metals vendor. Pr: Available through specialty suppliers of lanthanides. Tc: Acquire from a nuclear materials supplier (license required).
steps: B: Obtain from a chemical supplier or online marketplace. Nd: Purchase from a rare earth metals vendor. Pr: Available through specialty suppliers of lanthanides. Tc: Acquire from a nuclear materials supplier (license required).

1. Measure 6g of Boron (B) using a digital scale. 2. Measure 4g of Neodymium (Nd). 3. Measure 1g of Praseodymium (Pr). 4. Measure 2g of Technetium (Tc). 5. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all measured materials thoroughly until homogeneous. Use a spatula to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 6g of Boron (B) using a digital scale. 2. Measure 4g of Neodymium (Nd). 3. Measure 1g of Praseodymium (Pr). 4. Measure 2g of Technetium (Tc). 5. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all measured materials thoroughly until homogeneous. Use a spatula to ensure even distribution.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible made of alumina. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible made of alumina. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace door until the temperature is below 500°C to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace door until the temperature is below 500°C to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once the sample has cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified material from the crucible. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the material into the required dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once the sample has cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified material from the crucible. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the material into the required dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
